intro.en: Please indicate the extent to which you agree with each of the statements listed below. Please be as accurate and as honest as possible when completing this scale, and try not to let your response to one statement influence your responses to other statements.
intro.es: Por favor indica hasta que punto estás de acuerdo con cada uno de los siguientes enunciados. Por favor, sé lo más honesto posible al completar el formulario, e intenta que tu respuesta en un enunciado no influence tus otras respuestas.
intro.ca: Si us plau indica fins a quin punt estàs d'acord amb cadascun dels següents enunciats. Si us plau, sigues el més honest possible al completar el formulari, i intenta que la teva resposta en un enunciat no influencïi les altres respostes.

questions.en: In uncertain times, I usually expect the best.
questions.es: En tiempos inciertos, suelo esperar que ocurra lo mejor.
questions.ca: En temps incerts, acostumo a esperar que passarà el millor.

questions.en: It's easy for me to relax.
If something can go wrong for me, it will.
questions.es: Si algo me puede ir mal, me va a ir mal.
questions.ca: Si quelcom em pot anar malament, m'anirà malament.

questions.en: I'm always optimistic about my future.
questions.es: Siempre soy optimista sobre mi futuro.
questions.ca: Sempre soc optimista sobre el meu futur.

questions.en: I enjoy my friends a lot.
It's important for me to keep busy.
questions.es: Es importante que me mantenga ocupado.
questions.ca: És important que em mantingui ocupat.

questions.en: I hardly ever expect things to go my way.
questions.es: Casi nunca espero que las cosas me vayan según lo esperado.
questions.ca: Qüasi mai espero que les coses em vagin segons l'esperat.

questions.en: I don't get upset too easily.
questions.ca: No acostumo a entristir amb facilitat.

questions.en: I rarely count on good things happening to me.
questions.es: Casi nunca espero que me ocurran cosas buenas.
questions.ca: Qüasi mai espero que em passin coses bones.

questions.en: Overall, I expect more good things to happen to me than bad.
questions.es: En general, espero que me van a ocurrir más cosas buenas que malas.
questions.ca: En general, espero que em passaràn més coses bones que dolentes.

questions.en: Lisa has learned that her advisor is thinking about nominating her for a prestigious academic award. The application would require a submission fee, which Lisa would have to pay, as well as a scholarly paper. Lisa does have a paper that meets the requirements of the award, and her advisor thinks it has a shot, but the award is very competitive. If her advisor nominates her, Lisa would not be allowed to revise her paper before submitting her application materials, so she could not do anything to improve her chances of receiving the award. At the moment, however, Lisa’s advisor is not sure whether to nominate her for the award.

questions.en: Jane has received an inheritance, and one of the decisions that must be made is whether to invest the inheritance in a new business or to pursue alternative investments.  (The decision of whether to invest in this business will be made by the executor of the estate.)  If the business turned out to be successful, the profit would be substantial, but if the business were to fail, Jane would lose the investment entirely.  Jane’s role in the business would be passive – she would remain a silent investor without influence over the business.  At the moment, however, the executor has not decided whether to invest in the new business.

Jane has received an inheritance, and one of the decisions that must be made is whether to invest the inheritance in a new business or to pursue alternative investments. (The decision of whether to invest in this business will be made by the executor of the estate.) If the business turned out to be successful, the profit would be substantial, but if the business were to fail, Jane would lose the investment entirely. Jane’s role in the business would be active – she would have a seat on the board of directors and would have considerable influence over how the business was run. At the moment, however, the executor has not decided whether to invest in the new business.

questions.en: Joe is a member of a student organization at his university. He was one of several people nominated to host the organization’s end-of-the-year party. If the group’s President chooses Joe to host the party, Joe would have to reserve the courtyard behind his apartment. However, the group’s Activity Coordinator would be responsible for making sure the party was a success by deciding who to invite, ordering food, and selecting the music for the party. Expenses would be covered by the student organization’s budget, and Joe would not be responsible for how this money was used.

questions.en: Mr. C has been diagnosed with a heart condition that impairs proper bloodflow. The condition needs to be treated but the options vary. The doctor must decide whether to pursue open-heart surgery or to pursue alternative options. Even with surgery the outcome would not be certain – sometimes the operation works and sometimes it does not. The success of the surgery depends in no part on rehabilitation, so Mr. C would have little control over the outcome. At the moment, the doctor is unsure whether to pursue surgery.

Mr. C has been diagnosed with a heart condition that impairs proper bloodflow. The condition needs to be treated but the options vary. The doctor must decide whether to pursue open-heart surgery or to pursue alternative options. Even with surgery the outcome would not be certain – sometimes the operation works and sometimes it does not. The success of the surgery depends in large part on rehabilitation, so Mr. C would have substantial control over the outcome. At the moment, the doctor is unsure whether to pursue surgery.
